meanings.definition: Align or position something relative to a specified point or direction.
meanings.sent1: She orientated the map towards the north.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter orientated the shelf to fit perfectly in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The cat orientated itself towards the warm sunlight coming through the window.
meanings.sent4: The dancer orientated her body gracefully in line with the music.
meanings.sent5: He orientated the telescope towards the bright star in the sky.

meanings.definition: Adjust or adapt to a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a new city, she orientated herself to the different lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The team had to orientate quickly to the changes in the project.
meanings.sent3: The robot orientated its sensors to detect the new obstacles in its path.
meanings.sent4: She needed to orientate her mindset to embrace the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: He orientated his schedule to accommodate the unexpected meeting.

meanings.definition: Become familiar with a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: The new student orientated herself to the layout of the school.
meanings.sent2: He needed time to orientate to the customs of the foreign country.
meanings.sent3: The puppy orientated to the smells of the park during its first visit.
meanings.sent4: She started to orientate to the daily routine of her new job.
meanings.sent5: He tried to orientate to the fast-paced nature of the city life.
